short_summary: Helicopter Services, Whooping Crane Field Work
full_summary:
### Helicopter Services for Whooping Crane Conservation

**Solicitation Number**: 5P420-23-0381/A

**Closing Date**: 2024-04-23T16:00:00

The Parks Canada Agency invites qualified contractors to submit a bid for helicopter services in support of Whooping Crane conservation efforts. The services will include:

* Aerial surveys of Whooping Cranes: nest surveys in EC120 (30 hours of flight time) and juvenile surveys in EC120 (26 hours of flight time)
* Deployment and retrieval of monitoring equipment at Whooping Crane nests: deployment in AS350B2 (22 hours of flight time) and retrieval in AS350B2 (17 hours of flight time)
* Capture and banding of juvenile Whooping Cranes: flights in AS350B2 (15 hours of flight time)

The contracted services will be provided for a period of 15 months, from the contract date to March 31, 2025, with an optional one-year extension from April 1, 2025, to March 31, 2026.

**Submission Guidelines**

To be considered, bids must be submitted via email or fax by 16:00 (MST) on the closing date. Only the email address `soumissionsouest-bidswest@canada.ca` will be accepted for submissions. Fax transmissions to 1-866-246-6893 will also be accepted.

**Important Requirements**

* Bidders must submit their bid in English or French.
* Late submissions will not be considered.
* The bid should not include any links to bid documents; rather, the documents should be attached as email attachments.

**Technical and Contractual Enquiries**

Enquiries regarding the solicitation should be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority at least five calendar days prior to the closing date. Enquiries received after this deadline may not receive a response.

**Required Documents**

bidder’s response to the solicitation should be based on the documents obtained from the Government Electronic Tendering Service through the Government of Canada tendering service at <https://www.canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities>. Any addenda will be available on the same platform.

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Please note that discrepancies between English and French documents may exist, and notifications should be made to the Contracting Officer if any issues are found.
